pr_title: Reduce BeaconState backing tree memory footprint by ~25%

timeline.message: Add compressed backing LeafNode implementation to save memory for container members with types < 32bytes

timeline.bodyText: Why are we appling this only when the byteIndex is zero? Can we not use a compressed tree node even when the byte index is not 0?
timeline.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText:
This optimization is primarily intended for 'small' types (like UInt64) in containers which are effectively value bytes right padded with zeroes to Bytes32 and are created exactly with
updateBackingNode(zeroLeafNode, 0, myUInt64ValueView)
If you are updating a node with idx > 0 that may only mean that this is a List/Vector with packed basic values and optimizing this case makes things more complicated and doesn't yield much benefit.
Here you may see what I'm referring to:
(sample backing tree of a Validator structure: )
├─┐
│ ├─┐
│ │ ├─┐
│ │ │ ├─[0x8c43edcff6f1d56f2a42072637c0cfd9467ddfccb918ce1a8c2d1babb9cdd658]
│ │ │ └─[0x4b601dde9b2bafe027be489bbdcf82ef00000000000000000000000000000000]
│ │ └─[0x92fcc742102977503966d35cb217fc55bd583232b0c551605c08b9c319485bb5]
│ └─┐
│   ├─[0x0040597307000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000]
│   └─[0x0]
└─┐
  ├─┐
  │ ├─[0xffffffffffffffff000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000]
  │ └─[0xffffffffffffffff000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000]
  └─┐
    ├─[0xffffffffffffffff000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000]
    └─[0xffffffffffffffff000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000]

Ideally the publicKey here (Bytes48) can be optimized as well cause it has 16 trailing zero bytes but for this case we would need more expensive check that all the bytes to right a zeroes while TreeNode.isZero() is almost free
